intro: Acetosella xiphophylla, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sorrel, is a low-growing perennial plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its leaves contain oxalic acid, which gives them a tart taste. Acetosella xiphophylla is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
